content: hi there the trees are quick and easy to craft and look good enough for me to
make this video I made the trees for this floaty Island thing but let's begin
first you will need some cardstock and a pair of scissors make the tree trunk
I cut a large piece of paper towards the end I have been eating oats again okay
observe I rolled the card stock like this then I started twisting it when we
are done this will definitely looks like a tree
let's cut away the extra rewind and open the roll then take some PVA glue and get
messy I applied lots of glue on the inside and a bit on the outside but
however we do this it will still get messy
the gluey mess actually has a purpose I'll explain it later as you can see I
rolled a tree trunk again and this time I twisted it even more the excessive
amount of glue makes it soggy and easier to shape totally intended ok that's done
let's make a smaller one wait this is not a knife well just remember to clean
your sword if you get white stuff on it here is the smaller piece let's just add
some glue and roll it into shape there we go
alright the tree trunks have dried and they seem solid and durable because I
know we are all lazy I will make the most low effort base so the trees can
stand well it's not even a base I start by cutting the bottom of the trunk so
that they can stand then I continued by not making the base sorry we'll get
there soon I'm making the branches first I cut smaller cardstock pieces for the
branches and as usual I applied lots of glue I started twisting the pieces into
shape of a branch here it's okay if you can't get it round a helix like shape
might look nice when we paint it for every branch
I left a bit of cardstock untwisted this was used to attach it to the trunk and
it's okay if your fingers get covered in glue you will accidentally create more
textures on the tree here is a bigger branch at times I actually just put glue
directly on my fingers and then started working on the cardstock piece
when the cardstock is all soggy from the blue it's easy to fit it on the trunk I
think the little one is starting to look
like something oh yes thank you Mike a train to porters you can also get your
name on the knife by giving me money sounds fair right okay never mind that
just a few more branches and we're done with this step when the glue has dried a
bit it's easy to bend the branches into a better shape and if you want to take
these twists to the next level you can add smaller branches on the big ones
it's your choice one more branch and the large tree is
also done great go to the kitchen and steal some sponges I first ripped off
the rough layer be careful I might rip you off then I made some irregular
roundish pieces first some larger ones and yeah the sponge will be used as
foking on the tree I just assumed you can read so I forgot to mention it
I made many sponge pieces small and large then find your mom stop her where
and tossed them in add your green color of choice and then massage the paint
into the sponge under no circumstances should you wear gloves the green paint
make sure that you will wash your hands at least once today
good for you there we have the green flocking I'll just wait for it to dry
while I go back to the base of the trees make cuts like this preferably with a
sharp knife I'm trying to make some roots for the base of the trunk
I later swept a utility knife so I won't kill myself all right there we go now we
just bend the roots up this will create a wider base I also pressed it down on a
flat surface now it seems good I did the small tree in the same way
I did a sneaky little trick that will punch holes through my terrain as you
can see I glued a toothpick into the trunk this is how it will work a few
holes won't bother me okay we have actually come quite far after a few
seconds of fluff we will start painting I made a mixture of brown and a bit of
black and started painting I covered the whole tree with this color now I can see
some uncovered blue spots but that's fine we'll just cover it later with
flocking once the dark brown had pride I painted with regular Brown I told you
about the messy glue textures in the beginning of this video now you can
start seeing them on to the next color this is a lighter brown and I try burst
with gentle strokes of the brush with this layer done it already looks
alright now I'm using a light tan to dry brush
some of the details I'm not sure if this made it better or worse well you gotta
try something I still want to do something perhaps
some subtle green areas will look good I'll just play around with the brush
yeah okay there we have the trees now we just need to figure out how to glue on
the flocking I stuck the trees into a piece of foam now it's easier I started
with the bigger pieces and just yeah glue them on top of the branches or
stuck the ends of the branches into the sponge I do have to admit the gluing
process didn't go as smoothly as it looks
between the edits I dropped the tree a few times and some of the sponges just
kept falling off
that's enough of the big sponges I'll start gluing in the little bits wherever
they seem to fit at this point I noticed the sponges are a bit too bright next
time I'll use a darker green but we're still gonna do some painting so let's
see
all right this is looking better than expected just a few more pieces and
we'll move to the next step here I have a yellow-green mixture
I used this paint to dry brush the sponges now they aren't just green nice
a quick tip for you if you want to make the trees I would suggest painting the
sponges with dark green first then dry brush them with green and yellow green
good luck with that all right it's getting better but we're not done yet
I still want to work on the trunk I made a mixture of brown and yellow that I
used to color some of the highlights on the tree trunk yeah I think that was the
final touch we were looking for press like if you agree let's see if they work
the idea is just to stick them into terrain unless you have made some super
fancy terrain I don't believe anyone will notice a small hole or two and also
you could paint the holes black makes it less visible so there we have the trees
it stuck into the diorama I made in the last episode if you haven't seen it yet
you should I also have stuck in a sword and placed a ladder what else should we
make for this terrain if you have any good ideas go ahead and write them in
the comments below I know these trees aren't the most
realistic and you could make better ones using some wire I'm sure you have seen
wires raised before but the nice thing with this method of making trees is that
you only need the basics glue and some card stock if you want to make dead
trees you just leave out the sponge and you'll be fine they also seem pretty
strong and stable you can place miniatures on the trees and if you
happen to have some flatter pieces of sponge you can place normal minis on top
here you can see some of the miniatures I have crafted how can you learn to make
simple terrain and to craft custom miniatures just like these first
subscribe to Bart's craft and then you can find all the tutorials in these
playlists I've made just for you choose terrain or miniatures making these
videos is work if you appreciate what I'm doing you can support me on patreon
so check out my patreon and get yourself stuff you really don't need before we
end this episode I would like to thank a fellow nerd crafter for giving me the
inspiration for the trees he made a cool tree from Game of Thrones
I'll put a link to Frankie dear crafters channel in the descriptions below
I hope you enjoy the trees goodbye and happy crafting
